Angel Journey

| Software Developer & Support Specialist |

About Me

I’m a Software Developer with a background in customer service and operations management. I use my experience in client-facing conversations in combination with software development to make applications more user friendly.

I’m also a father, a husband, and fellow human trying to spread some good in this chaotic world. Like so many, last year was a difficult one that included me being laid off in October as my employer sold off my division. Having moved up the ranks from entry-level customer service to the management of two teams, I now faced finding a new job for the first time in five years, and in a very different economic environment. After a couple of months of job-searching not working out, a friend of mine offered to teach me python for free for a few weeks, a couple of hours each week. During this time I discovered I enjoyed software development but I needed a more structured environment to both lay out a roadmap and hold me accountable. This is where General Assembly Software Engineering Immersive stepped in and true to their word, they immersed me in software development for 8-10 hours a day, five days a week, for three months. I built out four projects, each time taking on a new challenge such as adding a back-end, working with a team, and/or working with a new language. I have found that while I am competent with back-end work, I enjoy the front-end more. Since graduating in June, I have transitioned into General Assembly’s Outcomes Program, which involves continuing to practice my development skills, networking, and applying for jobs. I am currently seeking opportunities where I can combine years of customer-service experience and fresh development skills to create positive, innovative solutions and improve the quality of life for others.

Technical Skills

Portfolio

diversify

(team project)

This application focuses on improving diversity in the workplace.

My latest project was a team project where I learned how to implement designs from UX/UI team members. I learned how to use Tailwind CSS and how to implement the third-party API EmailJS. ReactJS, HTML, and CSS were also utilized.

GrubClub

Allows users to manage potlucks they are hosting or attending.

With my latest solo project I used ReactJS, Express, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Express, MongoDB, and Mongoose. I learned how to leverage nested schemas, nested cards, and the accordion collapse tool.

devHead

(team project)

A developer-focused social-media application where the user can manage their posts.

As a team we utilized ReactJS, Express, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Express, MongoDB, and Mongoose. We also used GitHub for version control and Trello to manage our workflow.

Whim Vim

A web app where the user can manage a list of hobbies.

Utilized JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Express, MongoDB, and Mongoose to build my second web application. This was my first attempt at building out a backend.

Tika-Taka-Toe

Tic-Tac-Toe game with a soccer twist.

Utilized JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap to build my first frontend application.
